#define rot(a)  mat2(cos(a+vec4(0,11,33,0)))               // rotation 

void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U)
{
    float t=9., e=t;
    vec3  R =  iResolution, a,b,
          D = normalize(vec3(U+U, -12.*R.y) - R ),         // ray direction
          p = vec3(0,0,15), q,                             // marching point along ray 
          M = iMouse.z > 0. ? iMouse.xyz/R -.5 :           // comment for no mouse cam
                 vec3( .15,.07,0) * cos(.3*iTime + vec3(0,11,0)); 
          
    for ( O=vec4(1); O.x > 0. && t > .01; O-=.01 )         // march scene
        q = p,
        q.yz *= rot(-6.*M.y),                              // rotations
        q.xz *= rot(-6.*M.x-1.57),
        a = abs(q),
        a = a.y>a.x ? a.yxz : a,                           // sort a
        a = a.z>a.y ? a.xzy : a,
      //a = a.y>a.x ? a.yxz : a,
        b = abs(a-.6),
     // t = 9.,
        t = min( t, max( max(max(b.x,b.y) , a.z-.6 ) - .05,// full 3D shape: edges 
                        .1 - min(a.x,min(a.y,a.z)) )),     //                minus axe planes
        e = min(e, dot(q,q) ),                             // min dist to center point
        p += t*D;                                          // step forward = dist to obj          

   O *= O * 1.1;                                           // color scheme
   O.r += exp(-e*e*7.*(1.+.5*sin(3.*iTime)));              // halo
// O.r += sqrt(max(0., 1. - e*4. ));                       // transparent sphere
}
